result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
of Arraignment on October 8, 2015 before the Honorable David M. Reddy
Court Reporter : Eileen Walsh Grzenia
Defendant Rafael  Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Edward J. Hunt.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.

Defendant Rafael Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Edward J. Hunt.  
Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter is scheduled for a 5 day Jury Trial to begin on Monday.  
Attorney Hunt was just recently appointed on this case.  He is the 2nd Attorney assigned to this case.
Attorney Hunt advises there is voluminous discovery that he needs to review and is asking for a trial date in May.  
Mr. Olivarez has no objection to this.
Attorney Necci also has no objection to setting the trial out to May. 
The Court has another older case on its calendar that will be going to trial this coming Monday.  
Court schedules new FPT and JT dates.  
Court also extends the deadline for filing Motions to December 8th.  
Final pre-trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

The trials in cases 2014CF000195 and 2015CF000001 are back-to-back.

*TRANSCRIPT FILED 12/19/2016 - Court Reporter: Eileen Walsh Grzenia
Order Granting Motion to Withdraw as Counsel

Final pre-trial at 10-08-2015 02:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person at 10-12-2015 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial on October 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Rafael  Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Defendant Rafael  Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

Defendant Rafael Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 3:23 p.m. State calls Deputy Jennifer Schmidt who is duly sworn responds to direct exam of DA Necci. State's Exhibit S-1 marked and identifed by the witness (Copy of criminal complaint. State moves exhibit into evidence. No objection. Exhibit received. Defense has no questions. Witness excused.
Record closed @ 3:26 p.m.
3:26 p.m. - Argument by Attorney Schwantes
3:28 p.m. - Argument by DA Necci
3:29 p.m. - Court makes a finding and finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Information filed - reading waived. 

Defendant enters Not guilty plea and trial reserved. Motion deadline prior to STC on March 27, 2015

Court in recess @ 3:31 p.m.  Status conference scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Rafael Olivarez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Tracy L. McMiller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 9, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH E.J.S.   
OTHER CONDITIONS: Bond conditions from case 2014CF195 remain in effect.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
